page.title: 09Planning in the Wolfords
page.content: Planning restrictions are very tight in this area. Almost no new building is allowed by county councils. In about ten years, four new houses have been built in Great Wolford, 1 in 1985. There is no new building in Little Wolford apart from a converted barn. In spite of Todenham now being a conservation area, two new developments have been passed, one after going to appeal. One consists of seven houses, the other of four. Significant local opposition was expressed, and the fear that local people could not afford to buy these houses has been realised; they are proving somewhat difficult to sell. They are however built of stone as are three of the new houses in Great Wolford.
